passages.text:
Wiggly begins inspecting the panel before you.

Wiggly::Alright, I just need to swap out a few of these wires, and...

Wiggly::Oh.  That's...That's not good.  That's very not good.

Wiggly::Miss, I have some bad news.  One of the fuses on the elevator control panel has disappeared.  See?

[[C->Fuse Missing]]

links.name: C
links.link: Fuse Missing

passages.name: Start

passages.text:
He points to a vacant piece of real estate on the panel.

Wiggly::I'm sorry miss, but there's no way to get the elevator to the bottom floor.

[[What good is a fuse anyway?  I didn't think this complex had power.]]
[[p:The fuse is gone?  Why would anyone have taken it?  What good is it to anybody?]]

links.name: What good is a fuse anyway?  I didn't think this complex had power.
links.link: What good is a fuse anyway?  I didn't think this complex had power.

links.name: p:The fuse is gone?  Why would anyone have taken it?  What good is it to anybody?
links.link: p:The fuse is gone?  Why would anyone have taken it?  What good is it to anybody?

passages.name: Fuse Missing

passages.text:
Wiggly::I...have no clue, on either count.

Wiggly::But somehow I am not shocked that the elevator has been disabled.  Minerva has been reacting...antagonistically towards you.  More so than any other client I've ever guided through.  

[[p:So, the city itself magically stole the fuse?  Because it doesn't like me?]]

links.name: p:So, the city itself magically stole the fuse?  Because it doesn't like me?
links.link: p:So, the city itself magically stole the fuse?  Because it doesn't like me?

passages.name: p:The fuse is gone?  Why would anyone have taken it?  What good is it to anybody?

passages.text:
Wiggly::Not necessarily.  One of the other ferrymen might have decided to block access to the children's ward - at least one ferryman has disappeared there.  

Wiggly::It's also possible some scrapper stole it for himself.  That ward is full of valuables, so looters sometimes pay a visit if they are extremely desperate.  Maybe one of them decided they didn't want any competition.

Wiggly::Somehow, though, I feel like Minerva is giving you another sign.

[[What happened to the ferryman who disappeared there?]]
[[Scrappers steal stuff from the children's ward?  I thought it was extremely dangerous.]]
[[p:We need to find another route to the basement.]]

links.name: What happened to the ferryman who disappeared there?
links.link: What happened to the ferryman who disappeared there?

links.name: Scrappers steal stuff from the children's ward?  I thought it was extremely dangerous.
links.link: Scrappers steal stuff from the children's ward?  I thought it was extremely dangerous.

links.name: p:We need to find another route to the basement.
links.link: p:We need to find another route to the basement.

passages.name: p:So, the city itself magically stole the fuse?  Because it doesn't like me?

passages.text:
Wiggly::Oh, yes.  That incident was quite a while ago, actually.  The Ferryman's name was Thompson, I think.  He was an adoptee turned ferryman, like me, though we didn't know each other very well.

Wiggly::The story I heard is that he had some sort of breakdown, and abandoned a client somewhere in the maternity ward.  Maybe they came across something that set him off?

Wiggly::He wasn't heard from after that.  We can't even be sure he made it to the children's ward, though I'd say it was pretty likely.  He was reasonably experienced, like myself, and that's the only place in this part of the city where he wouldn't be found.

Wiggly::The client, fortunately, did make it out.  Poor guy had to navigate the drains and sewers by himself, and apparently his lamp ran out of juice towards the end.  But ultimately he made it, and told the broker what I just told you.

[[C->p:So, the city itself magically stole the fuse?  Because it doesn't like me?]]

links.name: C
links.link: p:So, the city itself magically stole the fuse?  Because it doesn't like me?

passages.name: What happened to the ferryman who disappeared there?

passages.text:
Wiggly::It is extremely dangerous.  The scrappers that come here cannot afford to care.  

Wiggly::Most of them are in pretty desperate positions, and because the children's ward is dangerous and difficult to access, lots of valuable stuff is still left behind.  Jewelry, antiques, electronics, medicine, drugs, collectable toys, that sort of stuff.

Jasper,head_tilted::Collectable toys?  Hmmmm.

[[C->p:So, the city itself magically stole the fuse?  Because it doesn't like me?]]

links.name: C
links.link: p:So, the city itself magically stole the fuse?  Because it doesn't like me?

passages.name: Scrappers steal stuff from the children's ward?  I thought it was extremely dangerous.

passages.text:
Wiggly::There are no other routes.  Every basement level door was locked shut before the city was even abandoned.  Even the utility tunnel connections were blocked off.  

Wiggly::They only neglected to seal the basement elevator entrance because they had rewired the elevator to never go there.  But, you can bypass those locks by swapping a few of these cables around.

Wiggly::Or rather, you could, before the fuse disappeared.

[[They really wanted to keep people out, huh?]]
[[(Action) Inspect the elevator equipment shed.]]
[[1,:So if we pull this lever, the elevator will plummet to the bottom floor?]]
[[2,p:I know what to do.  I'll go wait in the elevator cabin.  Then, you'll pull the lever, and I'll drop down to the children's ward.]]

links.name: They really wanted to keep people out, huh?
links.link: They really wanted to keep people out, huh?

links.name: (Action) Inspect the elevator equipment shed.
links.link: (Action) Inspect the elevator equipment shed.

links.name: 1,:So if we pull this lever, the elevator will plummet to the bottom floor?
links.link: 1,:So if we pull this lever, the elevator will plummet to the bottom floor?

links.name: 2,p:I know what to do.  I'll go wait in the elevator cabin.  Then, you'll pull the lever, and I'll drop down to the children's ward.
links.link: 2,p:I know what to do.  I'll go wait in the elevator cabin.  Then, you'll pull the lever, and I'll drop down to the children's ward.

passages.name: p:We need to find another route to the basement.

passages.text:
Wiggly::Yeah, they did.  Unusual phenomena started plaguing the children's ward before Minerva was even abandoned.

Wiggly::I don't like going there.  I almost never do.  I only suggested we investigate that ward out of desperation.

[[C->p:We need to find another route to the basement.]]

links.name: C
links.link: p:We need to find another route to the basement.

passages.name: They really wanted to keep people out, huh?

passages.text:
On the left side of the room, you see a large, metallic lever, reminiscent of an antique prop from an old horror film.  The lever appears to be a circuit breaker switch for the elevator machinery.

[[C->Don't touch that!]]

links.name: C
links.link: Don't touch that!

passages.name: (Action) Inspect the elevator equipment shed.

passages.text:
Wiggly::The hospital complex doesn't have power, but this elevator equipment does.  So do a few of the surgical rooms.

Wiggly::The central power grid hasn't been functional since the city collapsed, but hospitals and certain pieces of critical infrastructure were supplied with backup high density fuel cannisters.  

Wiggly::So stuff like surgical suites, elevators, ventilators, and the like could still run during power outages.

[[That room Julia took me to had working surgical lights.  I guess that's how.]]
[["High density fuel sources?"]]

links.name: That room Julia took me to had working surgical lights.  I guess that's how.
links.link: That room Julia took me to had working surgical lights.  I guess that's how.

links.name: "High density fuel sources?"
links.link: "High density fuel sources?"

passages.name: What good is a fuse anyway?  I didn't think this complex had power.

passages.text:
Wiggly::If the room she brought you to had working lights and equipment, then yes, I imagine so.

[[C->Fuse Missing]]

links.name: C
links.link: Fuse Missing

passages.name: That room Julia took me to had working surgical lights.  I guess that's how.

passages.text:
Wiggly::SATURN Core inventions - little cylinders you can plug into compatible circuits.  They make a weird screaming noise when you put your ear against them.  

Wiggly::They last for decades but sometimes aren't particularly stable.

Wiggly::They're powering this elevator machinery just fine, though.  Hear that hum?

Wiggly::The lights in this room are also powered - the skylights are artificial.

[[C->Fuse Missing]]

links.name: C
links.link: Fuse Missing

passages.name: "High density fuel sources?"

passages.text:
Wiggly::Don't touch that!  That will cut the circuit for the elevator equipment, including the backup magnetic locks keeping the elevator from falling. 

Wiggly::The cables for this elevator are totally rotten.  The magnetic backups are the only thing keeping the cabin suspended.

[[C->p:We need to find another route to the basement.]]

links.name: C
links.link: p:We need to find another route to the basement.

passages.name: Don't touch that!

passages.text:
Wiggly::Yes.  But why would you want to do that?  All that would accomplish is permanently disabling the elevator.

[[Is finding the missing fuse an option?]]

links.name: Is finding the missing fuse an option?
links.link: Is finding the missing fuse an option?

passages.name: 1,:So if we pull this lever, the elevator will plummet to the bottom floor?

passages.text:
Wiggly::Miss.  Please.  That's ridiculous - bordering on suicidal, even.  Once this line is cut, and the break is released, nothing will serve to retard the elevator's free-fall.

Wiggly::The elevator is idling on the roof and would drop all the way down to the sub-basement.  That's over a ten meter drop.

Jasper,head_tilted::Don't let him talk you out of it.  You know what you came here for.

[[Do I?]]
[[If I jump right before the elevator hits the ground, I'll float to the ground and be uninjured.]]
[[1,;p:If you don't go along with it I'll pull the lever and just jump down the elevator shaft.]]

links.name: Do I?
links.link: Do I?

links.name: If I jump right before the elevator hits the ground, I'll float to the ground and be uninjured.
links.link: If I jump right before the elevator hits the ground, I'll float to the ground and be uninjured.

links.name: 1,;p:If you don't go along with it I'll pull the lever and just jump down the elevator shaft.
links.link: 1,;p:If you don't go along with it I'll pull the lever and just jump down the elevator shaft.

passages.name: 2,p:I know what to do.  I'll go wait in the elevator cabin.  Then, you'll pull the lever, and I'll drop down to the children's ward.

passages.text:
Wiggly::We have absolutely no lead on what happened to the first one, and the ones employed here are of a very unique, specialized type, so we won't be able to find a replacement fuse either.

[[C->p:We need to find another route to the basement.]]

links.name: C
links.link: p:We need to find another route to the basement.

passages.name: Is finding the missing fuse an option?

passages.text:
Jasper,thinking::Yeah.  You do.

Wiggly::What's that, miss?

[[C->2,p:I know what to do.  I'll go wait in the elevator cabin.  Then, you'll pull the lever, and I'll drop down to the children's ward.]]

links.name: C
links.link: 2,p:I know what to do.  I'll go wait in the elevator cabin.  Then, you'll pull the lever, and I'll drop down to the children's ward.

passages.name: Do I?

passages.text:
Wiggly::Miss, that is a common misconception.  If you are hurdling towards the ground at 20 meters per second, and jump up at a speed of 1 meter per second, well...

Wiggly::You'll hit the ground at 19 meters per second.

Jasper,thinking::Ugh.  We already knew that.  I was really hoping he didn't, though.

Jasper,twisted::We'll have to secure his compliance some other way.

[[C->2,p:I know what to do.  I'll go wait in the elevator cabin.  Then, you'll pull the lever, and I'll drop down to the children's ward.]]

links.name: C
links.link: 2,p:I know what to do.  I'll go wait in the elevator cabin.  Then, you'll pull the lever, and I'll drop down to the children's ward.

passages.name: If I jump right before the elevator hits the ground, I'll float to the ground and be uninjured.

passages.text:
Jasper,twisted::Yeah, force his hand.  Good idea.  Now collaborating with the plan is the "safe" option for him.

Jasper,head_tilted::Still, he looks pretty shaken.

Wiggly::Miss, I can't stop you from doing this.  But please, think hard about whether or not this is worth it.  

Jasper,surprised::He's coming around to the plan.

Wiggly::You might break your legs in the fall, or your spine.  There would be nothing at all I could do to help you.  

Wiggly::Is that how you want this to end?  Starving to death at the bottom of an elevator shaft with two broken legs and no painkillers?

[[p:Yes that's how I want to go out.]]
[[p:That's not going to happen.  The elevator isn't likely to fall at free-fall speed, and it's not that far of a drop anyway.->p:Yes that's how I want to go out.]]

links.name: p:Yes that's how I want to go out.
links.link: p:Yes that's how I want to go out.

links.name: p:That's not going to happen.  The elevator isn't likely to fall at free-fall speed, and it's not that far of a drop anyway.
links.link: p:Yes that's how I want to go out.

passages.name: 1,;p:If you don't go along with it I'll pull the lever and just jump down the elevator shaft.

passages.text:
Wiggly::You really are gonna go through with this, aren't you?  There's no talking you out of it.

Jasper::He sounds almost disappointed in himself.  A better ferryman might have convinced you to drop this, he's thinking.

[[C->Let's do this]]

links.name: C
links.link: Let's do this

passages.name: p:Yes that's how I want to go out.

passages.text:
He does not return your thanks.  He looks sullen, hollow, even a little guilty.  He reaches into his pocket.  

[[C->Opium]]

links.name: C
links.link: Opium

passages.name: p:Alright.  Thanks for helping with this.

passages.text:
Wiggly::Miss, you might want this.  Just in case the descent goes poorly.

[[p:What's in this pill capsule?]]

links.name: p:What's in this pill capsule?
links.link: p:What's in this pill capsule?

passages.name: Opium

passages.text:
Wiggly::It's fentamide, miss - an opiate derivative.  All ferrymen keep some on their person, in case of emergencies.  If you end up immobilized at the bottom of the shaft, well, this might be an appealing option.

[[p:...Just in case I get injured and need painkillers...right?]]
[[p:How much of these do I need to take to die?]]

links.name: p:...Just in case I get injured and need painkillers...right?
links.link: p:...Just in case I get injured and need painkillers...right?

links.name: p:How much of these do I need to take to die?
links.link: p:How much of these do I need to take to die?

passages.name: p:What's in this pill capsule?

passages.text:
The ferryman nods, silently.

[[C->You Ready]]

links.name: C
links.link: You Ready

passages.name: p:(Accept the fentanyl) I hope I won't need it.  But, thanks.

passages.text:
Wiggly::Well, I'm not certain.  But, have it your way.

He returns the pill to his pocket.

[[C->You Ready]]

links.name: C
links.link: You Ready

passages.name: p:(Decline the fentanyl) Thanks, but it won't come to that.  I'm certain.

passages.text:
Wiggly::Alright.  No point in putting this off.  Head back to the elevator, and when I hear you banging the roof, I'll release.

[[p:Thanks for helping with this.]]

links.name: p:Thanks for helping with this.
links.link: p:Thanks for helping with this.

passages.name: You Ready

passages.text:
Wiggly::I'm pretty sure you shouldn't be thanking me.

[[p:(Action) Exit the machine room and head back to the elevator.]]

links.name: p:(Action) Exit the machine room and head back to the elevator.
links.link: p:(Action) Exit the machine room and head back to the elevator.

passages.name: p:Thanks for helping with this.
p:(Action) Exit the machine room and head back to the elevator.

passages.text:
Wiggly::Ugh.  Fuck, ok.  

Wiggly::Go get in the elevator.  Smack the roof a couple of times when you get there, so I know you're inside.  Then I'll disconnect the cable and pull the lever.

[[p:Alright.  Thanks for helping with this.]]

links.name: p:Alright.  Thanks for helping with this.
links.link: p:Alright.  Thanks for helping with this.

passages.name: Let's do this

passages.text:
Wiggly::...

Wiggly::C'mon Miss, you know what they're for.

Wiggly::If you end up stuck at the bottom of that shaft with your legs broken, I won't be able to help you.  No one can.

[[p:(Accept the fentanyl) I hope I won't need it.  But, thanks.]]
[[p:(Decline the fentanyl) Thanks, but it won't come to that.  I'm certain.]]

links.name: p:(Accept the fentanyl) I hope I won't need it.  But, thanks.
links.link: p:(Accept the fentanyl) I hope I won't need it.  But, thanks.

links.name: p:(Decline the fentanyl) Thanks, but it won't come to that.  I'm certain.
links.link: p:(Decline the fentanyl) Thanks, but it won't come to that.  I'm certain.

passages.name: p:...Just in case I get injured and need painkillers...right?

passages.text:
Wiggly::Just take all of them.  I won't be asking for the leftovers.

[[p:(Accept the fentanyl) I hope I won't need it.  But, thanks.]]
[[p:(Decline the fentanyl) Thanks, but it won't come to that.  I'm certain.]]

links.name: p:(Accept the fentanyl) I hope I won't need it.  But, thanks.
links.link: p:(Accept the fentanyl) I hope I won't need it.  But, thanks.

links.name: p:(Decline the fentanyl) Thanks, but it won't come to that.  I'm certain.
links.link: p:(Decline the fentanyl) Thanks, but it won't come to that.  I'm certain.

passages.name: p:How much of these do I need to take to die?
